subject: Travel
title: Hawaii Volcanoes National Park
description: A short lesson to help you apply Hawaii Volcanoes National Park.

hook.text: Hawaii's KÄ«lauea volcano has been erupting almost continuously since 1983. It's one of Earth's most active.

buildup.text: Lava flows from KÄ«lauea have added over 500 acres of new land to Hawaii's coastline.

discovery.text: Native Hawaiians consider the volcano home to Pele, the goddess of fire. Lava is her sacred creation.

twist.text: In 2018, a massive eruption destroyed over 700 homes. Lava rivers flowed at 17 mph through neighborhoods.

climax.text: Despite the danger, Hawaiians don't evacuate permanently. Living near Pele is part of their identity.

punchline.text: They share their island with a goddess who reshapes it.

quiz.question: Who is Pele in Hawaiian mythology?
options: The goddess of fire and volcanoes
